title: 110_s454
content: The Act may be cited as the "Improving Access to Higher Education Act of 2007" and includes an increase in Federal Pell Grants. The Higher Education Act of 1965 is amended to increase the Federal Pell Grant amount to $5,100 for the academic year 2007-2008, with an adjustment based on the expected family contribution. Additionally, $4,331,000,000 is appropriated for the same academic year. The Higher Education Act of 1965 is amended to increase the Federal Pell Grant amount to $5,100 for the academic year 2007-2008, with an adjustment based on the expected family contribution. $4,331,000,000 is appropriated for the same academic year to increase the maximum Pell Grant by $1,050. The amendments will take effect on July 1, 2007. Expansion of deduction for interest on education loans. Increased Limitation on Education Loan Interest Deduction: The maximum deduction for interest on education loans is increased to $3,750 for the taxable year. Additionally, the phaseout limits are raised to $75,000 ($150,000 for joint filers) and will be adjusted for inflation after 2007. The amendments made by this section increase the deduction for interest on education loans to $3,750 for the taxable year, with phaseout limits raised to $75,000 ($150,000 for joint filers) and adjusted for inflation after 2007. These changes apply to taxable years beginning after December 31, 2006, and the sunset provisions of the Economic Growth and Tax Relief Reconciliation Act of 2001 do not apply to the elimination of the 60-month limit and increase in income limitation on student loan interest deduction. SEC. 4. COVERDELL EDUCATION SAVINGS ACCOUNTS. The allowable contributions to Coverdell Education Savings Accounts are increased from $2,000 to $3,000. Reports for these accounts must be filed by June 30 of the following year. These changes apply to taxable years starting after December 31, 2006. SEC. 5. REPEAL OF EGTRRA SUNSET FOR EMPLOYER-PROVIDED EDUCATIONAL ASSISTANCE. Title IX of the Economic Growth and Tax Relief Reconciliation Act of 2001 will not apply to the extension of exclusion for employer-provided educational assistance in section 411 of the Act.
